logP.References: Hansch, C., Leo, A., D. Hoekman. Exploring QSAR - Hydrophobic, Electronic, and Steric Constants. Washington, DC: American Chemical Society., 1995., p. 85

mechanism_of_action.References: Gilman, A. G., L. S. Goodman, and A. Gilman. (eds.). Goodman and Gilman's The Pharmacological Basis of Therapeutics. 6th ed. New York: Macmillan Publishing Co., Inc. 1980., p. 899
mechanism_of_action.Value: DOMINANT ACTION OF THIAZIDES IS TO INCR RENAL EXCRETION OF SODIUM & CHLORIDE & ACCOMPANYING VOL OF WATER. THIS EFFECT IS VIRTUALLY INDEPENDENT OF ACID-BASE BALANCE. /BENZOTHIADIAZIDE DIURETICS/

mechanism_of_action.References: Gilman, A. G., L. S. Goodman, and A. Gilman. (eds.). Goodman and Gilman's The Pharmacological Basis of Therapeutics. 6th ed. New York: Macmillan Publishing Co., Inc. 1980., p. 901
mechanism_of_action.Value: RENAL ACTIONS OF THIAZIDE DIURETICS DECR EXTRACELLULAR FLUIDS & PLASMA VOL, CARDIAC OUTPUT, & TOTAL EXCHANGEABLE SODIUM IN INDIVIDUALS WITHOUT ANY EVIDENCE OF CARDIAC FAILURE. AT THIS STAGE, SODIUM & WATER DEPLETION APPEARS TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE BASIS FOR ANTIHYPERTENSIVE EFFECT... /BENZOTHIADIAZIDE DIURETICS/

mechanism_of_action.References: Gilman, A. G., L. S. Goodman, and A. Gilman. (eds.). Goodman and Gilman's The Pharmacological Basis of Therapeutics. 6th ed. New York: Macmillan Publishing Co., Inc. 1980., p. 901
mechanism_of_action.Value: GLOMERULAR FILTRATION RATE MAY BE REDUCED BY THIAZIDES... THIS IS PRESUMABLY RESULT OF DIRECT ACTION ON RENAL VASCULATURE. ...THIAZIDES DECR RENAL EXCRETION OF CALCIUM RELATIVE TO THAT OF SODIUM, SINCE ITS REABSORPTION IS UNAFFECTED IN DISTAL NEPHRON WHEREAS THAT OF SODIUM IS BLOCKED. /BENZOTHIADIAZIDE DIURETICS/

mechanism_of_action.References: Gilman, A. G., L. S. Goodman, and A. Gilman. (eds.). Goodman and Gilman's The Pharmacological Basis of Therapeutics. 6th ed. New York: Macmillan Publishing Co., Inc. 1980., p. 804
mechanism_of_action.Value: BECAUSE HEMODYNAMIC MEASUREMENTS INDICATE THAT PERIPHERAL VASCULAR RESISTANCE IS DECR BY THIAZIDES, DIRECT ACTION OF THESE DRUGS ON ARTERIOLAR SMOOTH MUSCLE HAS BEEN SUGGESTED. /BENZOTHIADIAZIDE DIURETICS/

mechanism_of_action.References: USP Convention. USPDI - Drug Information for the Health Care Professional. 17th ed. Volume I. Rockville, MD: Convention, Inc., 1997. (Plus Updates)., p. 1258
mechanism_of_action.Value: Thiazide diuretics increase urinary excretion of sodium and water by inhibiting sodium reabsorption in the early distal tubules. They increase the rate of delivery of tubular fluid and electrolytes to the distal sites of hydrogen and potassium ion secretion, while plasma volume contraction increases aldosterone production. The increased delivery and increase in aldosterone levels promote sodium reabsorption at the distal tubules, thus increasing the loss of potassium and hydrogen ions. /Thiazide diuretics/

mechanism_of_action.References: USP Convention. USPDI - Drug Information for the Health Care Professional. 17th ed. Volume I. Rockville, MD: Convention, Inc., 1997. (Plus Updates)., p. 1258
mechanism_of_action.Value: Diuretics lower blood pressure initially by reducing plasma and extracellular fluid volume; cardiac output also decreases. Eventually, cardiac output returns to normal. Thiazide diuretics decrease peripheral resistance by a direct peripheral effect on blood vessels. /Thiazide diuretics/

mechanism_of_action.References: USP Convention. USPDI - Drug Information for the Health Care Professional. 17th ed. Volume I. Rockville, MD: Convention, Inc., 1997. (Plus Updates)., p. 1258
mechanism_of_action.Value: The antidiuretic effect of thiazide diuretics is a result of mild sodium and water depletion leading to increased reabsorption of glomerular filtrate in the proximal renal tubule and reduced delivery of tubular fluid available for excretion. /Thiazide diuretics/

mechanism_of_action.References: USP Convention. USPDI - Drug Information for the Health Care Professional. 17th ed. Volume I. Rockville, MD: Convention, Inc., 1997. (Plus Updates)., p. 1258
mechanism_of_action.Value: Thiazide diuretics decrease urinary calcium excretion by a direct action on the distal tubule, which may prevent recurrence of calcium-containing renal calculi. /Thiazide diuretics/

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: JANATA V, LEGE L; INT Z KLIN PHARMAKOL, THER TOXIKOL 6(2) 125 (1972)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: CHRONIC ADMIN OF 0.1 MG OF POLYTHIAZIDE IV TO RATS INCR LACTATE CONCN IN KIDNEY CORTEX & INCREASED LACTATE & LACTATE DEHYDROGENASE IN THE MEDULLA.
ADMIN OF POLYTHIAZIDE 2.5 MG/KG IV TO ANESTHETIZED RATS MARKEDLY DECR THE ATPASE ACTIVITY IN THE KIDNEY CORTEX, BUT NOT IN THE MEDULLA.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: JANATA V ET AL; CESK FARM 19(MAR) 53 (1970)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: POLYTHIAZIDE EFFECTED METABOLISM IN RAT KIDNEY.

AFTER 3 CONTROL DAYS, RATS ADMIN 0.1 MG/100 G/DAY OF POLYTHIAZIDE FOR 6 DAYS. IN INTACT RATS HYPOCALCIURIA ASSOC WITH INCR SODIUM EXCRETION & URINE OUTPUT ON TREATMENT DAY 1. IN THYROPARATHYROIDECTOMIZED RATS HYPOCALCIURIA OCCURRED WITHOUT CHANGES IN NA EXCRETION OR BODY WT.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: MUKHERJEE PK ET AL; INDIAN MED GAZ 15(10) 396 (1976)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: IN RABBITS, POLYTHIAZIDE DEPRESSED URIC ACID URINARY EXCRETION & INCREASED THE BLOOD URIC ACID LEVEL; THE FORMER EFFECT WAS NOT RELATED TO THE DIURETIC EFFECTS OF POLYTHIAZIDE.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: DONATI RM ET AL; CIRC RES 22(1) 91 (1968)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: IN ACUTE EXPERIMENTS, IP INJECTION OF 0.1 MG OF POLYTHIAZIDE TO RATS INCREASED RENIN ACTIVITY WITHOUT SIGNIFICANTLY CHANGING ERYTHROPOIETIN ACTIVITY.
